Kh-59/69 missile to Boromyla, Sumy Oblast.
Launched from a Su-57

In the Dobropillya and Druzhkivka directions, Russian forces continued their assault operations on a wide front, making new progress in four different areas.
In the south, following several attempts, Russian infantry managed to gain a foothold in the railway windbreaks north of Rodynske and began accumulating infantry for additional attacks through the windbreaks further west. Other forces in central Rodynske managed to infiltrate the former "Zaporozhskaya" Mine west of the city. Fighting also continues for central Zatyshok, where the Russians are trying to dislodge the remaining Ukrainian soldiers.
To the north, Russian forces managed to consolidate in two more clay mines, along with additional forested areas and treelines. Attacks are now being carried out further north, where assault groups have reached the southern outskirts of Kucheriv Yar once again. Renewed fighting is also ongoing for Ivanivka, and Russian soldiers are continuing their attacks in western Nove Shakhove.
To the northeast, Russian forces continued advancing north from Shakhove and captured new positions southwest of Toretske. Fighting is ongoing for a large trench fortification there. Additionally, Russian forces managed to further improve their positions in the treelines northeast of Sofiivka. 
+ ~7.55 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll
Kh-59/69 missile to Boromyla, Sumy Oblast.  Launched from a Su-57

The Kh-59/69 cruise missile was shot down as it approached the Sumy-Poltava border. 
An explosion was heard in Sumy, likely from the launch of a patriot missile which intercepted the Russian missile. 
A Russian Su-57 continues to fly in Kursk Oblast, covered by a Su-35.

In addition to the strikes on the Kryvyi Rih TPP, eastern Dnipropetrovsk Oblast also came under attack.  - 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from Millerovo Airbase, Rostov Oblast, impacted an unknown target in the town of Petropavlivka [Media 2].  ‚Ä¶

Footage has been released showing last night's Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strike on eastern Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
1 missile (not 2) targeted a concentration of Ukrainian manpower and vehicles near the village of Troitske, just east of Petropavlivka.

For some reason, after months of constant updates, all of the so-called Pro-Ukrainian sources aren't reporting on the Dobropillya direction anymore... 
ü§î
As I've said before, your silence and selective reporting is a betrayal to Ukraine - the country you claim to support so much.

New footage shows FP-2 drones of the Ukrainian "Kairos" battalion of the 414th Special Operations Brigade striking rear Russian targets in Donetsk Oblast. 
The following was hit:
- "Myrna" 330 kV electrical substation in the city of Mariupol (47.185541, 37.561191) by 2 drones. 2 of the substation's transformers were damaged.
- "Azovska" 220 kV electrical substation in the city of Mariupol (47.164252,37.513224) by 1 drone. 1 of the substations transformers was damaged.
- Warehouses containing rockets and artillery shells of the Russian 51st Guards Combined Arms Army in Donetsk City (48.065319,37.851658) by 2 drones. A fire broke out, followed by secondary detonations. 
Additionally, it is claimed that drones also struck an oil depot in the city of Makiivka.

In the Kostyanytnivka direction, both sides have advanced, with Russian forces continuing to collapse Ukrainian defences southwest of Kostyantynivka.
In the west, Russian forces continued their attacks in the direction of Stepanivka and managed to capture the remaining positions in the forest plantations west of the village, before entering its first houses (without consolidating yet). Russian attacks also continued from the treelines to the south. 
To the southeast, Russian forces continued advancing east along the highway, capturing new positions in the treelines there and operationally encircling Ukrainian formations in their strongpoints to the south. Other assault groups are now clearing out the pocket, capturing strongpoints in the forests.
Meanwhile, Russian forces continued infiltrating in small groups through the forests and into the village of Illinivka. Ukrainian drone operators continue attempts at fully eliminating the Russian groupings there, however the total number of Russian soldiers recorded in the village is growing. 
To the east, Russian forces consolidated in additional positions in the forests on the northern bank of the Kleban-Byksky reservoir, and managed to enter the agricultural buildings on the southern outskirts of Beretok. On the other hand, the Ukrainians are continuing their incremental withdrawal from their last positions in the forests north of the reservoir due to the risk of encirclement.
To the northeast, Russian forces continued to advance in Kostyantynivka, and began bypassing the railway station from the north, capturing positions in the residential streets across the highway. However, more recently, they have begun struggling with supplies due to increased Ukrainian FPV drone strikes on the area between the city and Oleksandro-Shultyne. 
Meanwhile, at some point recently, Ukrainian forces managed to clear the Hora District of northeastern Kostyantynivka from Russian DRGs, as well as the adjacent forests, where they are now trying to accumulate. Additionally, the Ukrainians infiltrated across the fields south of the highway and recaptured the western and central parts of Predtechyne again. They also improved their positions in the forests just north of the highway.
Russian forces are now trying to counterattack in Predtechyne, and continue their attempts at consolidating in the eastern part of the forests north of the highway. DRGs are also infiltrating further west through the treelines, where they were able to reach the village of Novodmytrivka. This has resulted in some of the Ukrainian formations in the salient west of Chasiv Yar withdrawing further west. 
+ ~5.24 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
+ ~3.97 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

Russian forces have captured the village of Bondarne, Rai-Oleksandrivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~43.
Total land area: ~0.89 km¬≤.
The fighting for Bondarne lasted approximately 20 days.

Situation on Aleppo [13/1/2026]:
After the victory in Aleppo, the STG took advantage of the momentum gained with Turkish-American diplomatic support to prepare for an offensive in the east of Aleppo governorate, sending reinforcements together with the SNA (& TSK support) to the Tishrin and Deir Hafer fronts, as well as to Raqqa, on the Ma'dan-Ghanem Ali axis. Consequently, the SDF has also sent reinforcements to these fronts in anticipation of a large-scale confrontation that will end any attempt at diplomacy in Syria and mark the beginning of a new violent phase of the civil war.

Consequently, the SDF has also sent reinforcements to these fronts in anticipation of a large-scale confrontation that will end any attempt at diplomacy in Syria and mark the beginning of a new violent phase of the civil war.

Any integration of the SDF into the STG seems extremely unlikely anymore, although I doubt Turkey would've allowed it anyway.
Happy new year everyone!  Best of luck to you all for 2026.

Well, the first two weeks of 2026 have been very eventful.
- The U.S. bombs Venezuela and kidnaps Maduro.
- The Southern Transitional Council in Yemen capitulates after a lightning offensive by the PLC.
- Russia strikes Lviv with an Oreshnik IRBM.
- Aleppo finally falls to the new Syrian government.
- Mass protests in Iran.
- Trump expressing his wish to annex Greenland again.
It's gonna be a busy year...
Russian Geran-3 jet-drones are currently attacking the Kyiv Hydroelectric Power Plant. Explosions are heard.
Another Geran-3 is approaching the CHP-5 power plant in Kyiv.
Another Geran-3 is approaching the CHP-5 power plant in Kyiv.
It flew further east, away from the power plant in the direction of Boryspil.

The drone turned back to Kyiv and was subsequently shot down over the southern outskirts of the city. 
Multiple more Geran-3 jet-powered drones seem to be flying to Kyiv from Chernihiv Oblast.

Former Dutch Mercenary In Ukraine Reveals Kiev's Crimes
While the Western media strives to prevent the crimes committed by the Ukrainian troops from becoming known to public opinion, the mercenaries themselves who join Kiev in the war are shocked by the reality they find on the front lines. Recently, a European veteran of the Ukrainian army told journalists what he saw in the ranks of Kiev, revealing details about the behavior of the regime's soldiers.
A former Dutch mercenary who fought for Kiev told journalists during a recent interview that Ukrainian troops are full of all types of criminals, including neo-Nazi militants and drug traffickers - including members of foreign cartels. He said that the use of illicit substances and practices of corruption and theft are common activities among soldiers, as there are no ethical or moral guidelines regulating the behavior of troops. The Dutch soldier used the pseudonym Hendrik, omitting his true identity for security reasons.  
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Egypt Struck Arms Shipment Bound To UAE Allies In Sudan 
The Egyptian Air Forces carried out strikes against an arms shipment bound to the Sudanese Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in the border triangle between Egypt, Sudan and Libya, Al-Araby Al-Jadeed reported on January 12.
An Egyptian official told the London-based Arab news outlet that the strike took place on January 9, two days before a visit to Cairo by Saddam Haftar, a senior commander in the Libyan National Army (LNA).
During the visit, which was his second to Cairo within a month, Saddam Haftar met Egypt‚Äôs defense minister, Abdel-Magid Saqr, to discuss military cooperation and regional developments, according to the official, who revealed that Cairo had previously warned LNA leader Khalifa Haftar against providing support to the RSF.
Egypt and the UAE are generally considered to be close allies. Still, the latest Egyptian strikes appear to be a part of wider regional efforts, led by Saudi Arabia, to quell Emirate influence.
Read more 
HERE

India's Drone Revolution: Creating A New Force Of 100,000  To Deter China And Pakistan
While Russia and Ukraine continue to bash each other on the battlefield and within their borders, other countries are taking note. One of them is India.
New Delhi is trying to absorb the fundamentals of modern warfare and create an efficient military with innovative technology. Since February 2022, the Indian high command and top military leaders have had ample time to consider this. Being sandwiched between the hostile communist nation of China and the even more hostile Islamist nation of Pakistan necessitates cleverness in the realm of external security.
Even India, with its enormous population, has realized that numbers alone cannot win wars anymore. To prevail, your army must be large and capable of rapid deployment, as well as equipped with modern technology, especially unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs).
üëâ

Israel Rejects Deployment Of Russian Troops In Syria, And Arms Deals Between Damascus And Moscow
Israel rejected a Russian initiative aimed at deploying military forces and observation posts in southern Syria, Maariv reported on January 14, citing an Israeli official.
Reports of the initiative began to emerge last August, and in November Syrian and Russian defense officials were spotted conducting a tour in the southern governorates of al-Qunitra and Daraa.
The Israeli military invaded the buffer zone adjacent to the occupied Golan Heights in al-Qunitra right after the fall of the regime of former President Bashar al-Assad, and has since established a series of posts there, including atop of the strategic Mount Hermon.
The official who spoke to Maariv said that the military will not withdraw from the Mount Hermon in Syria.
He added that Israel is following ‚Äúwith great concern‚Äù the ongoing contacts between Syria and both Russia and Turkey, especially those related to potential arms deals.
Read more 
HERE

U.S. Evacuates Key Middle East Bases Following Warning From Iran 
Iran warned other countries in the Middle East that it will strike U.S. military bases on their territories in case of an attack by Washington, Reuters reported on January 14.
The report came right after President Donald Trump renewed his threats to the Islamic Republic over an ongoing wave of protests.
Trump told CBS News that the U.S. would act if Iran began hanging protesters, after Tehran prosecutors said Iranian authorities would press capital charges of ‚Äúmoharebeh,‚Äù or ‚Äúwaging war against God,‚Äù against some suspects arrested over recent demonstrations.
In its latest report, the U.S.-based rights group Human Rights Activists News Agency (HRANA) put the death toll from the protests, which began late in December, at 2,403 people.
Not all the casualties were protestors, however, Iranian authorities held a mass funeral of 300 security personnel who were killed in the protests.
Read more 
HERE

Russia‚Äôs Security Zone In Sumy And Kharkiv Is Growing (Videos)
On January 14, the Russian military secured another settlement in Sumy along the border, all while further expanding its control near the border in Kharkiv.
The capture of Komarivka, located right on Sumy‚Äôs border with the Russian region of Kursk, by the Severe [North] Group of Forces was announced by the Russian Ministry of Defense, with other sources reporting that the attack on the settlement was led by the 80th Motor Rifle Division.
The ministry also noted in a  statement that the Sever Group of Forces has been advancing ‚Äúinto the depth of enemy‚Äôs defense‚Äù not just in Sumy, but also in Kharkiv -which borders the Russian region of Belgorod-, on a daily basis to fulfill the task of creating a ‚Äúsecurity zone‚Äù along the border.
Read more
